msgSnippet: ... That s excellent. Downloading now. Thanks ... I ve just pre-ordered your book on BN. Looking forward to reading it. I m currently delving into several XP
messageBody:
> [I said:]
> > I have implemented equals methods on my classes so if they are not
> > equal (not the same, but equal). In fact, I do some tests on my
> > equals functions by taking 2 objects that should be equal, and also
> > comparing 2 objects that are not. I also verify that they are not
> > the same objects (i.e. obj1 == obj2)
>
> [Dave responded with:]
> Have a look at the Gargoyle extensions that Mike Bowler has written:
>
> http://gsbase.sourceforge.net/
>
> Part of it is EqualsTester which does a comprehensive verification of
> a class's equals() and hashCode() methods. It saves alot of test code.

That's excellent. Downloading now. Thanks

> > In fact, I just got hired by this company and they don't do ANY
> > testing... I'm trying to move them forward in this, so I appreciate
> > the tips.
>
> Are they interested in improving that?
>
> <This message contains commercial content, reader disgression is advised>
>
> Also, watch for my book in July: http://www.adaptionsoft.com/tddapg.htm
>
> </commercial content>

I've just pre-ordered your book on BN. Looking forward to reading it. I'm
currently delving into several XP books (Java Tools for Extreme Programming,
as well as the Oreilly XP Cookbook)

> > I'll look into Mocks. I've read a little about them, but I'm trying
> > to take baby steps...
>
> They can take a bit of effort to grok... but they are a very powerful
> testing tool. I suggest EasyMock (www.easymock.org) as well as
> MockObjects (http://www.mockobjects.com)

Thanks for the links. Got them bookmarked.

> > My main concern is that the functionality involved serializing to a
> > file, so I thought I'd need to exercise that in a test (i.e., saving
> > to a known location, then making sure it loads from the same known
> > location, etc).
>
> 1) I'd consider that more of an integration level test (which needs to
> be done, but not as part of TDD)
> 2) when TDDing you should try to avoid using external resources as
> much as possible
> 3) use createTempFile.. see
> http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4.1/docs/api/java/io/File.html#createTempFile(j
> ava.lang.String,%20java.lang.String)

Got a lot to learn about TDDing. Sucks trying to learn this while attempting
develop software with a deadline...

Thanks for the tips, and I'm sure this list will be hearing from me again.
